name: Shen Panwen
content:
Shen Panwen (Chinese: 申泮文; pinyin: Shēn Pànwén; 7 September 1916 – 4 July 2017) was a Chinese chemist.[2][3]
 Shen was born in September 1916 in Jilin City, Jilin, with his ancestral home in Conghua, Guangzhou and studied chemistry at National Southwestern Associated University.[4]
 He taught at Nanjing University and was named an academician of the Chinese Academy of Sciences in 1980.[5]
 Shen died at the age of 100 on 4 July 2017.[6]
 
 
 This biographical article about a Chinese scientist is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. This biographical article about a chemist is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
tags: Members of the Chinese Academy of Sciences
raw:
Shen Panwen申泮文Born(1916-09-07)7 September 1916Jilin City, Jilin, China[1]Died4 July 2017(2017-07-04) (aged 100)Tianjin, China[1]NationalityChineseEducationNankai High SchoolAlma materNankai UniversityNational Southwestern Associated UniversityScientific careerFieldsInorganic chemistryInstitutionsChinese Academy of Sciences (CAS)

In this Chinese name, the family name is  Shen.
Shen Panwen (Chinese: 申泮文; pinyin: Shēn Pànwén; 7 September 1916 – 4 July 2017) was a Chinese chemist.[2][3]
Shen was born in September 1916 in Jilin City, Jilin, with his ancestral home in Conghua, Guangzhou and studied chemistry at National Southwestern Associated University.[4]
He taught at Nanjing University and was named an academician of the Chinese Academy of Sciences in 1980.[5]

Death[edit]
Shen died at the age of 100 on 4 July 2017.[6]

References[edit]


^ a b 申泮文先生逝世. Nankai University (in Chinese). 4 July 2017.

^ 申泮文院士：“允公允能”世纪路. sciencenet.cn (in Chinese). 11 September 2015.

^ 科技日报：那个“九段”骑车高手走了——追忆中国科学院院士申泮文. Nankai University (in Chinese). 7 August 2017.

^ 张道正 (4 July 2017). "原标题：著名化学家申泮文去世 享年101岁" (in Chinese). Sina Corp. Retrieved 1 August 2017.

^ "Shen Panwen". China Vitae. Retrieved 1 August 2017.

^ "我国著名化学家、中国科学院院士申泮文同志因病逝世". China National Radio. 4 July 2017. Retrieved 1 August 2017.
